joehung302 wrote:
> I wonder if this is a known problem. I did a simple test crawl using 
> the following configuration:
> 
> - SurtPrefixScope, the scope file contains one line 
>   +http://(com,
> 
> - I put one line in the seeds.txt file
>   http://aol.com
> 
> - I put an SurtPrefixFilter in the exclude filter chain, with the 
> surt file containing one line 
>   http://(com,aol,

You need a '+' here too. We might have previously accepted SURTs in the
specified file without a '+', but when seed and SURT parsing was unified,
the '+' became necessary for SURT-only directive lines. Without the '+',
the line gets interpreted as a normal URI and generates a garbage SURT
instead of what's intended. This should be more tolerant, but I think
adding a '+' will restore the behavior you expect.

- Gordon @ IA
